column4: REFILE-Superior Industries draws eyes to investor push-back
column5: LONDON  June 9 (IFR) - Superior Industries' debut euro deal offered another sign of growing investor push-back against aggressive high-yield deal terms  with a US-style covenant loophole that could enable key assets to be insulated from creditors removed from the bond's documents.

column4: Syngenta sells sugar beet seeds business to Denmark's DLF Seeds
column5: ZURICH  June 9 Syngenta  the Swiss pesticides and seeds group being bought by ChemChina  has agreed to sell its global sugar beet seeds business to Denmark's DLF Seeds  the companies said on Friday.

column4: 8th Circuit affirms $14M verdict against Toyota in unintended acceleration case
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday affirmed a $14 million jury verdict against Toyota Motor Corp arising from a fatal rear-end collision involving a 1996 Camry  rejecting the company’s claim that the jury was swayed by inadmissible evidence.

column4: 6th Circuit says UPS must comply with EEOC subpoena on medical records
column5: A U.S. appeals court on Friday ordered United Parcel Service Inc to deliver information on how it tracks workers' medical conditions to the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission  marking the third time in recent weeks that a court has rejected a challenge to a subpoena from the agency.

column4: UPDATE 2-F-35 jets grounded at U.S. Air Force base in Arizona -officials
column5: June 9 The stealthy F-35 fighter jets made by Lockheed Martin Corp were temporarily grounded at a U.S. Air Force base in Arizona on Friday because of irregularities in pilots' oxygen supplies  an Air Force spokesman said.

column4: Brazil's Vale signs $2 bln credit line  replacing 2013 agreement
column5: SAO PAULO  June 9 Brazilian mining firm Vale SA said on Friday it had lined up a five-year $2 billion revolving credit facility  replacing a five-year $2 billion line agreed in 2013.
